result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Lloyd Dishaw was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: This judgment is for fines, court costs and restitution that you were ordered to pay through Dept of Corrections - if not paid during probation - or you get revoked  and have not paid in full - you will be required to pay to the Clerk of Courts any unpaid amount plus interest.

supervisions.notes: 9 months county jail with Huber IMPOSED & STAYED

1 year probation, conditions: costs $ 243.00, restitution $ 2278.13 (arrears) plus surcharges, pay child support each month in full and on time, DEF may petition for early discharge if arrears are paid. $ 500.00 bond to DOC to pay on arrears.

miscConds.notes: Restitution of $ 2278.13 plus surcharges   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$243.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Pay child support in full and on time. $ 500.00 bond forwarded to DOC to pay on arrears.

records.addlTxt: 45 days jail added as condition of probation with Huber privileges
Extend Probation 18 months addition of Seek Work Condition

Defendant Robert Lloyd Dishaw in court, in custody.   No appearances from the State.  Heather Lessard appears from DOC.  DE's mother Linda Hollen appears by phone.
Judge Robert Eaton appears by phone from Ashland County.
Heather Lessard makes statement.  Court questions DE.  
Heather Lessard states continued non-compliance with supervision.  DE makes statement.  DE's mother interrupts to make statement, but court is unable to hear due to bad reception.
Court finds DE has not exercised good faith in paying obligations, not compliant with probation, extends probation 18 months and adds Seek Work condition if not already ordered.
Request/Agreement for modification of conditions of probation - 45 days of jail added as a condition of probation will be served with huber privileges effective date, judge aproves request.
Probation review hearing on September 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert Lloyd Dishaw in court with attorney Michael Arthur Kelsey.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Arrearage as of March, 2015: $2,278.13. Back child support is most likely higher at this time.   Victim notification complied with.
DE pled N/C. to amended charge 948.22(3). Court finds DE guilty.
 Sentence: Nine (9) months county jail with Huber, stayed. One (1) year probation. Condition of probation: pay child support each month, in full and on time. If arrearage is paid off early, DEF can petition to be released from balance of probation. Pay court of costs: $443.00 and restitution of back child suppport of $2278.13 as of March, 2015, to be worked out with agency. Bond on deposit to be forwarded to DOC to be applied to child support arrearages.
State files new information.    Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of information, waives reading of information
